Package menuSystem

The menu subsystem is presented upon launching the RoboSport370 application.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    MainMenu
    The code to set up the main menu.
    Menu
    Abstract class containing all of the shared methods for the menus handles initialization of the background image
    MenuController
    The driver of the menu system Handles the overall display about what the user inputs.
    MenuFactory
    A factory class to return the desired menu whenever it is requested The menu will only be created once and we will always return that same menu
    MockMenuOne
    A class used for testing the menuController.
    MockMenuTwo
    A class used for testing the menuController
    MultiplayerMenu
    The code to construct the multiplayer menu Almost complete: I want to make the entering names smoother for non computer scientists I asked for feedback and it wasn't entirely clear and i agree with this Functionality is all in place.
    RobotSelection
    The Code to set up the robot selection menu This menu also handles interaction with the robot librarian This class is incomplete
    Rules
    The code to draw and visually test the rules menu.
    SinglePlayerMenu
    The code to construct the single player menu

Package menuSystem Description

The menu subsystem is presented upon launching the RoboSport370 application. The current menu exists as a panel drawn within the main frame. The MenuController holds the main frame and keeps track of the stack of menus. The top item of the Menu stack is the menu currently being displayed - initially, the MainMenu. To keep Menu creation simple and to keep previously created menus cached, the module implements the ‘Factory method’.
